items.title: How to make clean energy accessible – anywhere on Earth
Living Factories: What AI Agents Could Mean For Industry
Inside our Industrial Metaverse Lab: Shaping the Future of Industry
Shore power instead of smoke: Clean ports
items.author: Siemens
items.summary:
- Ports are replacing diesel generators with *shore-side power* to reduce *CO₂ emissions*, nitrogen oxides, and pollutants. 
- Siemens' **SIHARBOR** system enables *automated synchronization* and handles *multiple voltages*, significantly decreasing port emissions like nitrogen oxide by *10,000 cars worth* in 8 hours.
- The modular and *cost-effective* system uses eco-friendly insulation, potentially saving *12,000 tons of CO₂ annually*, and supports *scalable* power supply for different ship sizes globally.

items.title: Faster, Lighter, Smarter: How Siemens Solutions Empower Oracle Red Bull Racing Performance
items.author: Siemens
items.summary:
- *Siemens’s digital solutions* help Oracle Red Bull Racing stay ahead with faster, lighter, and smarter car designs.
- The team uses *digital twin technology* and *powered design tools* for rapid adaptation to regulatory changes, reducing development time and material waste.
- Their integrated system provides *speed, precision,* and *control*, giving them a competitive edge in the high-stakes world of Formula 1 racing.

items.title: From the Computer to the Rails
items.author: Siemens
items.summary:
- Siemens uses *digital twins* to enhance train reliability by identifying issues early.
- The rail industry's shift towards digitalization leads to reduced development costs and faster processes.
- **Siemens** is now a leader in technology, leveraging operational data for predictive maintenance and creating immersive training for train operators.

items.title: Baking change: Mondelēz’s technological and cultural reboot
items.author: Siemens
items.summary:
- **Mondelēz International** embraces a transformative strategy leveraging data to boost factory performance instead of simply pursuing technology.
- Implementation of an **Azure-based IoT platform** enables real-time tracking of equipment efficiency, material flow, and energy consumption, significantly enhancing production processes.
- Central to success is integrating **change management** within the rollout, ensuring that new technology is adopted effectively across the organization.

items.title: From fossil fuels to climate leader: How one of Europe's biggest ports reinvents itself
items.author: Siemens
items.summary:
- The port of Bremerhaven aims for **carbon neutrality by 2035** using a sophisticated digital twin developed by bremenports and Siemens to simulate and optimize energy use and logistics.
- The strategy emphasizes **renewable energy** sources such as wind turbines and photovoltaics, comprehensive electrification, and smart energy management over reliance on hydrogen or battery storage.
- Bremerhaven's project sets a precedent for sustainable transformation in industrial hubs and is now part of Siemens Xcelerator, aiming to expand digital twin applications to other sectors for **lasting decarbonization impact**.

items.title: From Biomass to Wonder: How Digital Twins Power Nature's Smallest Protein Factories
items.author: Siemens
items.summary:
- *Digital twins* orchestrate *insect farms* at Bulgarian startup Nasekomo, turning agricultural by-products into sustainable protein using Black Soldier Flies.
- The process is highly efficient: larvae multiply body mass 10,000x in 12 days producing protein meal, insect oil, and organic fertilizer, monitored and optimized by *AI-powered sensors* and Siemens technology.
- Nasekomo’s approach aligns with the *circular economy* and *UN Sustainable Development Goals*, enabling a scalable, AI-driven franchise model for future global sustainable protein production.

items.title: GenAI for Engineers
items.author: Siemens
items.summary:
- *Generative AI* and Industrial Foundation Models (IFMs) are transforming engineering by enabling digital assistants that understand complex industrial data and assist with tasks like machining and design, making experts out of newcomers.
- Siemens, partnering with Microsoft Azure, leverages decades of AI expertise and extensive high-quality industrial data to create AI assistants that comprehend the multifaceted engineering 'language' including diagrams, models, and simulations.
- These AI-powered tools increase productivity and innovation in manufacturing and process design, shifting engineers’ focus to strategic decisions while automating routine work, heralding a new era of *AI-assisted* engineering innovation.

items.title: Digital Depot: How AI Is Shaping the Future of Train Maintenance
items.author: Siemens
items.summary:
- The Rhein-Ruhr-Express (RRX) achieves nearly **100% system availability** through AI-driven *predictive maintenance* that minimizes downtime by monitoring critical components via sensors and automating work order generation.  
- Integrated AI tools like Railigent X analyze real-time data to support maintenance decisions and optimize repairs, allowing operations similar to a *Formula 1 pit stop* in a compact depot space.  
- While *humans remain central* to train maintenance, AI continuously learns to improve forecasting, aiming to automate up to 100% of maintenance work orders and eventually reduce labor-intensive inspections.

items.title: The Architects of the Next Economy
items.author: Siemens
items.summary:
- *Treasury* is evolving from managing cash to becoming a *key architect* of digital transformation, enabling real-time decisions with AI, automation, and blockchain.
- Digital payments have surged by *156%* globally, yet B2B payments lag behind, presenting opportunities to *embed finance* for instant settlements and real-time liquidity.
- Siemens champions a *growth mindset* and collaborative innovation culture to position Treasury as a *strategic driver* shaping the future interconnected economy.
